title: Sample Description Wizard Messages
description: Defines messages used in the sample description process. 'text' holds the actual message; 'text_class' as used here are ordinary Bootstrap classes: text-primary, text-info, text-warning, text-danger, which give additional flexibility for conveying different message kinds to the user; 'text_options' are oriented towards a more question-type message that would require the user to make a choice in response. messages used within the context of dynamically generated stages are also captured here.

save_cell_message.text: Wrap up action interrupted due to an active cell edit! Please Save or Cancel active cell edit and retry

confirm_initial_sample_generation.title: Sample Generation
confirm_initial_sample_generation.text:
The specified number of samples will now be generated using the sample attributes you've entered.

Click Continue if you are happy to go ahead and generate the samples.
Note: In the next stage, you will be able to modify attribute values for individual samples or group of samples.
Click Review to modify the attributes entries you've so far made.

review_message.text:
Description metadata for your samples are presented below as discrete attribute values. You can modify specific attribute values for individual samples. Additionally, you can batch-update attribute values for groups of samples.
  • To update attribute value for a single sample:
    1. Click to focus on a cell (note: this action is different from row selection)
    2. Double-click or press 'Enter' on a focused cell to make it editable
    3. Make your changes and double-click or press 'Enter' again to save your changes
  • To batch-update corresponding attribute values for a group of samples:
    1. Click to focus on a target cell, the value of which will be used to update corresponding cells of selected records
    2. Click the checkbox beside required rows; selected rows will form the update batch
    3. Click the 'Update selected records' button
  • Click Next, when done editing, to proceed to the final stage
